textboxes.description: Em steps into a rundown gas station, the scent of stale coffee and gasoline thick in the air. Shelves are sparsely stocked, and everything seems coated in a layer of grime. A shady clerk watches her from behind the counter.

choices.text: Browse the shelves for canned food

skill_check.fail: Most cans are dented, expired, or suspiciously sticky. Em finds little of use.

choices.text: Approach the clerk to ask about fresh produce

skill_check.fail: The clerk sneers and points Em to a wilting head of lettuce in the corner.

choices.text: Search the back for cleaning supplies

skill_check.fail: Em finds an ancient bottle of bleach, but it’s nearly empty.

textboxes.description: Em scans the shelves and manages to find a can of beans that looks safe. It's not much, but it'll work for now.

choices.text: Take the can and pay at the counter

textboxes.description: The clerk pulls out a dusty crate with a few bruised fruits and vegetables. It’s not fresh, but Em might be able to salvage something edible.

choices.text: Select a couple of half-decent apples
Decline and leave the produce alone

textboxes.description: Em finds a rack of cleaning supplies, mostly empty. After a quick search, she uncovers a usable sponge and an almost-full bottle of disinfectant.

choices.text: Add the items to her basket
Put the items back and continue looking around

textboxes.description: Em heads to the counter with her items. The clerk gives her an odd look as he slowly tallies up her purchase, grumbling under his breath.

choices.text: Try to haggle the price down

skill_check.fail: The clerk glares, refusing to budge on the price.

textboxes.description: Em wanders the store a bit longer, realizing there’s not much else worth taking. The shelves are barren and the quality of goods questionable.
The apples are bruised but seem edible enough. Em takes them, hoping for the best.

choices.text: Head to the counter to pay

textboxes.description: Em hands over the cash, and the clerk mumbles something before shoving her change at her. She leaves with her supplies, feeling a mix of accomplishment and unease.
The clerk begrudgingly agrees to lower the price slightly. Em feels a small victory as she heads out with her items at a discount.
